metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2133 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel before 3.3.6, when hugepages are enabled, allows local users to cause a denial of service (systemcrash) or possibly gain privileges by interacting with a hugetlbfsfilesystem, as demonstrated by a umount operation that triggers improperhandling of quota data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-3.4.0-4-goldfish - 3.4.0-4.27
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-7-mako - 3.4.0-7.40
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-5-flo - 3.4.0-5.22
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required
